committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Domestic Marketing, Consumer Relations, and Nutrition

official_title: Recognizing the importance of the domestic fruit and vegetable industry in U.S. farm policy, and the importance of fruits and vegetables to the diets of the American people; requiring the Secretary of Agriculture to conduct a study of the domestic fruit and vegetable industry; and amending the Perishable Agricultural Commodities Act.

summary.text: Declares that the domestic production of fruits and vegetables is a keystone of U.S. farm policy. Directs the Secretary of Agriculture to study and report to the Congress on the domestic fruit and vegetable industry. Amends the Perishable Agricultural Commodities Act to permit the investment of Perishable Agricultural Commodities Act Fund reserve amounts.

titles.title: Recognizing the importance of the domestic fruit and vegetable industry in U.S. farm policy, and the importance of fruits and vegetables to the diets of the American people; requiring the Secretary of Agriculture to conduct a study of the domestic fruit and vegetable industry; and amending the Perishable Agricultural Commodities Act.
